name: fastly
description:
A Pulumi package for creating and managing fastly cloud resources.

> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-fastly)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-fastly` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-fastly/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-providers/terraform-provider-fastly` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-fastly/issues).

provider.description:
The provider type for the fastly package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-fastly/blob/master/website/docs/index.html.markdown.

fastly:index/servicev1:Servicev1.description:
Provides a Fastly Service, representing the configuration for a website, app,
API, or anything else to be served through Fastly. A Service encompasses Domains
and Backends.

The Service resource requires a domain name that is correctly set up to direct
traffic to the Fastly service. See Fastly's guide on [Adding CNAME Records][fastly-cname]
on their documentation site for guidance.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-fastly/blob/master/website/docs/r/service_v1.html.markdown.

acls.description: A set of ACL configuration blocks.  Defined below.

activate.description: Conditionally prevents the Service from being activated. The apply step will continue to create a new draft version but will not activate it if this is set to false. Default true.

activeVersion.description: The currently active version of your Fastly Service.

backends.description:
A set of Backends to service requests from your Domains.
Defined below. Backends must be defined in this argument, or defined in the
`vcl` argument below

bigqueryloggings.description:
A BigQuery endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

blobstorageloggings.description:
An Azure Blob Storage endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

cacheSettings.description: A set of Cache Settings, allowing you to override

conditions.description:
A set of conditions to add logic to any basic
configuration object in this service. Defined below.

dictionaries.description: A set of dictionaries that allow the storing of key values pair for use within VCL functions. Defined below.

directors.description:
A director to allow more control over balancing traffic over backends.
when an item is not to be cached based on an above `condition`. Defined below

domains.description:
A set of Domain names to serve as entry points for your
Service. Defined below.

dynamicsnippets.description: A set of custom, "dynamic" VCL Snippet configuration blocks.  Defined below.

forceDestroy.description:
Services that are active cannot be destroyed. In
order to destroy the Service, set `force_destroy` to `true`. Default `false`.

gcsloggings.description:
A gcs endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

gzips.description:
A set of gzip rules to control automatic gzipping of
content. Defined below.

headers.description:
A set of Headers to manipulate for each request. Defined
below.

healthchecks.description: Automated healthchecks on the cache that can change how Fastly interacts with the cache based on its health.

logentries.description:
A logentries endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

name.description: The unique name for the Service to create.

papertrails.description:
A Papertrail endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

requestSettings.description: A set of Request modifiers. Defined below

responseObjects.description: Allows you to create synthetic responses that exist entirely on the varnish machine. Useful for creating error or maintenance pages that exists outside the scope of your datacenter. Best when used with Condition objects.

s3loggings.description:
A set of S3 Buckets to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

snippets.description: A set of custom, "regular" (non-dynamic) VCL Snippet configuration blocks.  Defined below.

splunks.description:
A Splunk endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

sumologics.description:
A Sumologic endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

syslogs.description:
A syslog endpoint to send streaming logs too.
Defined below.

vcls.description:
A set of custom VCL configuration blocks. The
ability to upload custom VCL code is not enabled by default for new Fastly
accounts (see the [Fastly documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/vcl/uploading-custom-vcl) for details).

fastly:index/getFastlyIpRanges:getFastly.description:
Use this data source to get the [IP ranges][1] of Fastly edge nodes.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-fastly/blob/master/website/docs/d/ip_ranges.html.markdown.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getFastlyIpRanges.

cidrBlocks.description: The lexically ordered list of CIDR blocks.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing fastly cloud resources.
